name: Zhangye Danxia landform in Gansu
description: The rainbow formation is the result of red sandstone and mineral deposits being laid down for over 24 million years, according to theTelegraph.

name: The swing at the “End of the World” in Baños
description: At the edge of Ecuador sits a rickety tree house (casa del árbol) overlooking an active volcano in the near distance. With it comes a swing with no harnesses, inviting only the bravest of risk-takers to experience a killer view.

name: The Great Blue Hole
description: The Great Blue Hole is a submarine sinkhole off the coast of Belize. It’s one of the top scuba diving sites in the world and the water is more than 400 feet deep.

name: Tulip fields
description: Many people often mistake Keukenhof, also known as the Garden of Europe, as the designated space of the tulip fields. However, these majestic fields are located just outside the garden and are mostly privately owned.

name: The Hang Son Doong cave in Quang Binh Province
description: Son Doong is the world’s largest cave, created 2–5 million years ago. A half-mile block of 40-story buildings could fit inside it!

name: Hitachi Seaside Park in Hitachinaka, Ibaraki
description: The park is in full bloom during spring and tourists often visit to see 4.5 million “baby blue-eyes” flowers blossom.

name: Mendenhall Ice Caves of Juneau in Alaska
description: The cave lies beneath the Mendenhall Glacier and it melts as you walk through it.

name: Mount Roraima
description: The incredible tabletop mountains are some of the oldest geological formations on the planet, dating back about 2 billion years ago. This was also part of the inspiration for Paradise Falls in Disney’s UP.

name: Ancient Region of Anatolia in Cappadocia
description: The area has become a popular tourist area and a favorite spot for hot air ballooning.

name: Sea of Stars on Vaadhoo Island
description: What may appear as a mirror image of the stars above, the bioluminescence in the water is actually due to marine microbes called phytoplankton. The effect it has on the shore is absolutely breathtaking.

name: Victoria Falls
description: This 354-foot waterfall lies at the border of Zambia and Zimbabwe and it is the widest waterfall in Africa. There’s also a famous feature on the Zambian side called the Devil’s Pool, which allows adventurous tourists to hang out at the edge of the falls.

name: Trolltunga in Hordaland
description: Trolltunga is a piece of rock that hangs out of the mountain about 2,000 feet up in the air. The Troll’s Tongue (translation in English) is available to hikers from mid-June to about mid-September.

name: Whitehaven Beach
description: This beach is known for its beautiful white sands and the crystal clear blues and greens of the water. The sand is very fine and walks along the shore are so fantastical it seems like magic.

name: The Grand Canyon
description: This magnificent beauty is 277 miles long and 18 miles wide, and is considered one of the Seven Natural Wonders of the World

name: Marble Caves at General Carrera Lake
description: The Marble Caves, known as Marble Chapel and Marble Cathedral, are located at the center of the lake and were formed by waves over the past 6,000 years.

name: Tunnel of Love in Klevan
description: This railway engulfed in a tunnel of leaves is a Pinterest favorite and a Ukrainian hot spot for lovers. Although it’s undoubtedly romantic, there is an active train that travels through the tunnel three times a day to deliver wood to a factory. Just beware of the train before snapping engagement photos!

name: Salar De Uyuni in the Potosí and Oruro departments of southwest Bolivia
description: This is the world’s largest salt flat. It also becomes a giant mirror of the sky during the rainy season.

name: Enchanted Well at Chapada Diamantina in Bahia
description: Located at Chapada Diamantina National Park, this well’s water is 120 feet deep and is clear enough to see the rocks.

name: Antelope Canyon in Arizona
description: Located near Page, Ariz., this brilliant slot canyon is split into two different sections, commonly referred to as “The Crack” and “The Corkscrew.”

name: Fingal’s Cave on the island of Staffa
description: Although it may seem like this block structure is man-made, it was actually formed by lava flow. It kind of resembles the cave in Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince.

name: To Sua Ocean Trench in the Lotofaga village on the south coast of Upolu
description: To Sua is a giant hole in Lotofaga that was converted into a swimming pool with water flowing through a lava-tube tunnel.

name: Bamboo groves of Arashiyama in Kyoto
description: Often referred to as the “Bamboo Forest,” this tree-lined path is popular for walks and bicycle rides on a nice day.

name: Glowworm Caves in Waitomo
description: This specific spot in the Waitomo Caves is known as the Glowworm Grotto, a place where glowworms create a starry effect on the ceilings. This species is exclusively found in New Zealand and is around the size of a mosquito.

name: Haiku Stairs of Oahu in Hawaii
description: Stairway to Heaven is a steep hiking trail that is technically closed to the public, but many people continue to climb despite “No Trespassing” signs.

name: Volcanoes of Kamchatka
description: This large chain of volcanoes sits on the Kamchatka Peninsula, with 19 of them still active. The highest volcano is Klyuchevskaya Sopka, standing at almost 16,000 feet high.

name: Cenotes of Yucatán Peninsula
description: These sinkholes in Mexico were formed during the ice age and were held sacred by the Mayans.

name: Kelimutu crater lakes in Flores Island
description: The westernmost lake is called the Lake of Old People and is usually blue, and the other two are called the Lake of Young Men and Maidens and Bewitched or Enchanted Lake, which are typically green and red, respectively. The colors vary on a periodic basis and have become a popular tourist destination.

name: Meteora
description: Fascinating monastery on the top of the rock

name: Santorini Island
description: City with pleasant buildings

name: Angkor Wat
description: Abandoned monastery

name: Petra
description: Monastery in a rock

name: Machu Picchu
description: Ziccurats and Maya city

name: Cave in Algarve
description: Beach under the stone

name: Halong Bay
description: Picturesque bay

name: Pamukkale
description: Tons of salt, white terraces

name: Mu Cang Chai
description: Rice Terrace Fields

name: Monument Valley
description: You've seen it in the movies

name: Venice
description: See it before it diminishes under water

name: Plitvice Lakes
description: Wonder of nature

name: Lençóis Maranhenses
description: Lakes

name: Bora Bora
description: Dream island
